Hindlimb unloading (HU) is a microgravity analog in which a rodent’s hind limbs are suspended and in disuse . Frigeri et al. (OSD-32, 10.26030/
Flück et al. found increased myogenic factors, contractile genes, and metabolic genes during reloading .

Weightlessness causes a decrease in bone formation by osteoblasts and an increase in osteolytic functions of osteoclasts . Spaceflight significantly alters expression of gastrocnemius tissue genes associated with muscle growth .  Bone Marrow Stromal Cells (BMSC) are sensitive to mechanical loading . Monticone et al. (OSD-29, 10.25966/6rr8-r017) studied murine BMSC cultures that were onboard the ISS for 8 days . They found cell proliferation was inhibited in spaceflight conditions .

Chopard et al. (OSD-51, 10.26030/3w73-jn41) examined gene expression profiles of soleus and vastus lateralis muscles during long-term bedrest conditions . They reported an induction of metallothioneins, genes involved in antioxidant stress response, in the non-countermeasures groups .

Ward et al. (OSD-5, 10.25966/qq4z-4m04) detected ten downregulated genes related to immune response in activated T lymphocytes exposed to simulated microgravity (Rotating Wall Vessel) for 24 h . The authors concluded that cell type and cell growth condition influence whether microgravity affects DNA damage response .

Chang et al. (OSD-13, 10.26030/4an8-r968) studied T cells housed on the ISS . They found impaired T-cell activation as well as profound downregulation of Rel/NF-κB .CREB CREB and SRF . Human umbilical vein endothelial cells’ exposure to microgravity showed significant altered transcripts related to oxidative phosphorylation, stress response, cell cycle and apoptosis . Figure 2 shows volcano plots for all human musculoskeletal microarray datasets from OSDR . Genes with a log2-fold change above 1 are represented in red, signifying upregulated expression, while genes below −1 are depicted in blue, indicating downregulated expression .
